revision.text:
{{About|the Angry Birds franchise|the original video game|Angry Birds (video game)|the 2016 film|The Angry Birds Movie}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox media franchise | title = Angry Birds | image = Angry Birds logo 2015.svg | caption = The ''Angry Birds'' wordmark, used since July 2015 | creator = [[Rovio Entertainment]] | origin = [[List of video game franchises|Video game series]] | books = {{Collapsible list|title=Cook books|1=''Bad Piggies: Egg Recipes''}}{{Collapsible list|title=Documentary books|1=''Angry Birds: Hatching a Universe''}}{{Collapsible list|title=Activity books|1=''Angry Birds: The Big Green Doodle Book''|2=''Angry Birds: The Big Red Doodle Book''|3=''Angry Birds Space: Sticker Book''|4=''Angry Birds Space: Poster Book''|5=''Angry Birds Space: Colors''|6=''Angry Birds Space Learn to Draw''|7=''Learn to Draw Angry Birds''|8=''Angry Birds Official Guide''}}{{Collapsible list|title=Story books|1=''Angry Birds: Hunters of the Jade Egg''|2=''Bad Piggies: Piggy Island Heroes''}}{{Collapsible list|title=National Geographic
books|1=''Nat Geo Angry Birds Space: A Furious Flight into the Final Frontier''|2=''Nat Geo Angry Birds: 50 True Stories of the Fed Up, Feathered, and Furious''|3=''Nat Geo Angry Birds Star Wars: The Science behind the Saga''|4=''Nat Geo Angry Birds: Furious Forces''|5=''Nat Geo Angry Birds Seasons''|6=''Nat Geo Angry Birds Playground Series''}} | novels = | comics = *''Angry Birds Comics'' *''Super Angry Birds'' *''Angry Birds: Flight School'' | magazines = | films = *''[[The Angry Birds Movie]]'' (2016) *''[[The Angry Birds Movie 2]]'' (2019) | tv = | atv = *''[[Angry Birds Toons]]''{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w5px1IbyAjw|title=Promotional trailer|work=YouTube}} *''[[Piggy Tales]]'' *''[[Angry Birds Cheetos (TV series)|Angry Birds Cheetos]]'' *''[[Angry Birds Blues]]'' *''[[Angry Birds Toons#Angry Birds: Birld Cup|Angry Birds BirLd Cup]]'' | plays = | musicals = | games = | rpgs = | vgs = '''Angry Birds Series''' * ''[[Angry Birds (video game)|Angry Birds]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Seasons]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Rio]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Friends]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Space]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Star Wars]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Star Wars II]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Go!]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Epic]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Transformers]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Fight!]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds 2]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Action!]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Blast!]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Evolution]]'' * ''Angry Birds Match'' * ''[[Angry Birds Blast Island]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Dream Blast]]'' '''Spin-offs''' * ''[[Bad Piggies]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds Stella]]'' * ''[[Angry Birds POP!]]''* * ''[[Angry Birds Champions]]'' '''Compilations''' * ''[[Angry Birds Trilogy]]'' | radio = | soundtracks = | music = *Angry Birds Rio Samba Tune *Angry Birds Space Theme (feat. [[Slash (musician)|Slash]]) *Bad Piggies Halloween Tune (feat. [[Major Lazer]]) | toys = *Plush Toys *Board Games *Telepods | otherlabel1 = Beverages | otherlabel2 = Parks and Attractions | otherlabel3 = Official Website | otherdata1 = *Angry Birds Soft Drinks | otherdata2 = {{Collapsible list|title='''Angry Birds Land'''|1=Sarkanniemi Adventure Land (Finland)|2=Thorpe Park (U.K.)}}{{Collapsible list|title='''Angry Birds Space Encounter'''|1=Kennedy Space Center (U.S.)|2=Space Center Houston (U.S.)}}{{Collapsible list|title='''Angry Birds Activity Park'''|2=Vuokatti (Finland)|3=Holiday Club (Finland, Spain)|4=Haining City (China)|5=Activity Park (Malaysia)}} | otherdata3 = [https://www.angrybirds.com angrybirds.com] }} '''''Angry Birds''''' is a [[List of video game franchises|video game franchise]] created by [[Finland|Finnish]] company [[Rovio Entertainment]]. The series focuses on multi-colored birds who try to save their eggs from green-colored pigs, their enemies. Inspired by ''[[Crush the Castle]]'',{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.com/2012/10/bad-piggies-rovio/|title=Angry Birds Creator Has First Original Idea|publisher=[[Wired (magazine)#Website|Wired]]}} the game has been praised for its successful combination of fun gameplay, comical style, and low price. Its popularity led to many [[Spin-off (media)|spin-offs]], versions of ''Angry Birds'' being created for [[Personal computer|PC]]s and [[video game console]]s, a market for merchandise featuring its characters, [[Angry Birds Toons|a televised cartoon series]], and [[The Angry Birds Movie|a feature film]]. In January 2014 there had been over two billion downloads across all platforms, including both regular and special editions:{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/johngaudiosi/2013/03/11/rovio-execs-explain-what-angry-birds-toons-channel-opens-up-to-its-1-7-billion-gamers/|title=Rovio Execs Explain What Angry Birds Toons Channel Opens Up To Its 1.7 Billion Gamers|author=John Gaudiosi|work=Forbes.com|publisher=Forbes.com LLC|date=11 March 2012|access-date=12 March 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.edge-online.com/features/two-billion-downloads-were-just-getting-started-says-angry-birds-creator-rovio/|title=Two billion downloads? We’re just getting started, says Angry Birds creator Rovio|last=Long|first=Neil|date=23 January 2014|work=[[Edge (magazine)|Edge]]|publisher=[[Future plc]]|access-date=23 January 2014}} as of July 2015, the series' games have been downloaded more than three billion times collectively,{{cite web|title='Angry Birds 2' Arrives 6 Years And 3 Billion Downloads After First Game|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/andyrobertson/2015/07/16/angry-birds-2/|publisher=Forbes|access-date=16 July 2015|date=16 July 2015}} making it the most downloaded [[freemium]] [[List of best-selling video games|game series of all time]]. The original [[Angry Birds (video game)|''Angry Birds'']] has been called "one of the most mainstream games out right now", "one of the great runaway hits of 2010", and "the largest mobile app success the world has seen so far".{{cite web|title=Angry Birds will be bigger than Mickey Mouse and Mario. Is there a success formula for apps? |url=http://miter.mit.edu/article/angry-birds-will-be-bigger-mickey-mouse-and-mario-there-success-formula-apps |date=18 February 2011 |access-date=27 March 2011 |author1=Erik Holthe Eriksen |author2=Azamat Abdymomunov |author3=Dagens Næringsliv |work=MIT Entrepreneurship review |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110430114108/http://miter.mit.edu/article/angry-birds-will-be-bigger-mickey-mouse-and-mario-there-success-formula-apps |archivedate=30 April 2011 |df= }} [[The Angry Birds Movie|An animated feature film]] based on the series was released by [[Columbia Pictures]] on 20 May 2016, and the first main-series sequel, ''[[Angry Birds 2]]'', was released on 30 July 2015. The first game in the series was initially released in December 2009 for [[IOS]].{{cite web|url=http://wireless.ign.com/articles/107/1070605p1.html |title=Angry Birds Review |work=IGN.com |date=11 February 2010 |access-date=24 March 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100504135939/http://wireless.ign.com/articles/107/1070605p1.html |archivedate=4 May 2010 }} At the time, the [[Swine influenza|swine flu]] epidemic was in the news, so the staff made the birds' enemies pigs.{{Citation|last=iOS Game Updates|title=Angry Birds: Interesting Story Of The Most Popular Bird Slingshot Game|date=2018-08-16|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AljYFUooUr4|access-date=2018-08-17}} The company released ports of the game for other touchscreen [[smartphone]] operating systems, including [[Android (operating system)|Android]], [[Symbian]], and [[Windows Phone]], and PCs. In 2017, the company has valuated at $2.25 billion or more, the company named [https://www.zynga.com/ Zynga] which is another Game developer rejected the buyout offer of $2.25 billion, which experts say the company is worth more than the offered price. {{Cite news|url=https://www.researchsnipers.com/angry-birds-owners-worth-revealed-much-worth-rovio-angry-birds/|title=Angry Birds Owners Worth Revealed: How Much Is The Worth Of Rovio “Angry Birds” - Tech News Pakistan {{!}} Pakistan Business News|date=2017-02-27|work=Tech News Pakistan {{!}} Pakistan Business News|access-date=2018-11-30|language=en-US}} ==Video games== {{Timeline of release years | 2009 = ''[[Angry Birds (video game)|Angry Birds]]'' | 2010 = ''[[Angry Birds Seasons]]'' | 2011 = ''[[Angry Birds Rio]]'' | 2012a = ''[[Angry Birds Friends]]'' | 2012b = ''[[Angry Birds Space]]'' | 2012c = ''[[Angry Birds Star Wars]]'' | 2013a = ''[[Angry Birds Star Wars II]]'' | 2013b = ''[[Angry Birds Go!]]'' | 2014a = ''[[Angry Birds Epic]]'' | 2014b = ''[[Angry Birds Transformers]]'' | 2015a = ''[[Angry Birds Fight!]]'' | 2015b = ''[[Angry Birds 2]]'' | 2016a = ''[[Angry Birds Action!]]'' | 2016b = ''[[Angry Birds Blast!]]'' | 2017a = ''[[Angry Birds Evolution]]'' | 2017b = ''Angry Birds Match'' | 2018a = ''Angry Birds Blast Island''|2018b=''[[Angry Birds Dream Blast]]''}} {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Game !! Genre !! Description |- | December 2009 || ''[[Angry Birds (video game)|Angry Birds]]'' || rowspan="7" | [[Puzzle video game|Puzzle]] || The first game released of the series. It primarily involves shooting birds into pigs' fortresses. It has special version for Kakao messenger.{{cite web|url=http://www.phonesreview.co.uk/2010/11/25/ios-angry-birds-mighty-eagle-on-its-way-video/|title=iOS Angry Birds Mighty Eagle On Its Way: Video|work=phonesreview.co.uk|date=25 November 2010|access-date=30 November 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110102171109/http://www.phonesreview.co.uk/2010/11/25/ios-angry-birds-mighty-eagle-on-its-way-video/| archivedate= 2 January 2011 | deadurl= no}} |- | October 2010 || ''[[Angry Birds Seasons]]'' || The second game in the series, featuring holiday-themed levels. It was also originally released as ''Angry Birds Halloween''. |- | March 2011 || ''[[Angry Birds Rio]]'' || The third game in the series, tying in with the films ''[[Rio (2011 film)|Rio]]'' and ''[[Rio 2]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/218181/angry_birds_rio_release_teams_with_hollywood.html|title='Angry Birds Rio' Release Teams With Hollywood|author=Paul Suarez|work=PCWorld.com|date=29 January 2011|access-date=4 February 2011| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110205124337/http://www.pcworld.com/article/218181/angry_birds_rio_release_teams_with_hollywood.html| archivedate= 5 February 2011| deadurl= no}} |- | February 2012 || ''[[Angry Birds Friends]]'' || The fourth game of the series features weekly tournaments and is also available on [[Facebook]]. |- | March 2012 || ''[[Angry Birds Space]]'' || The fifth game in the series that features space physics.{{cite web|url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/250243/angry_birds_in_space_the_final_merchandising_frontier.html|title=Angry Birds in Space: The Final Merchandising Frontier?|author=Jeff Bertolucci|work=PCWorld.com|date=17 February 2012|access-date=18 February 2012}}{{cite web | url=http://kotaku.com/5891571/first-angry-birds-space-gameplay-footage-debuts-from-orbit/gallery/1 | title=First Angry Birds Space Gameplay Footage Debuts from Orbit | publisher=Kotaku | date=8 March 2012 | access-date=8 March 2012}} |- | November 2012 || ''[[Angry Birds Star Wars]]'' || The sixth game that ties in with the original ''[[Star Wars]]'' trilogy (''[[Star Wars (film)|Star Wars]]'' (1977), ''[[The Empire Strikes Back]]'' (1980), and ''[[Return of the Jedi]]'' (1983)). |- | September 2013 || ''[[Angry Birds Star Wars II]]'' || The seventh game of the series that ties in with the ''Star Wars'' prequel trilogy (''[[Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace|The Phantom Menace]]'' (1999), ''[[Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones|Attack of the Clones]]'' (2002), and ''[[Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith|Revenge of the Sith]]'' (2005)) and the television show ''[[Star Wars Rebels]]''. It is the first game compatible with Hasbro's Telepods, that allows the player to summon a specific character in the game. |- | December 2013 || ''[[Angry Birds Go!]]'' || [[Racing video game|Racing]] || The eighth game of the series and it is the first to branch off from the puzzle genre to the racing genre. |- | June 2014 || ''[[Angry Birds Epic]]'' || [[Role-playing video game|Role-playing]] || The ninth game of the series that features turn-based RPG combat and a gear and item crafting system. |- | October 2014 || ''[[Angry Birds Transformers]]'' || [[Side-scrolling video game|Side-scrolling shooter]] || The tenth game of the series, which ties-in with the ''[[Transformers]]'' franchise and is a shoot 'em up game.{{cite news|publisher=Grab It Indie Games Magazine|url=http://www.grabitmagazine.com/blog/post/oceanhorn-update-to-add-new-island-new-story-and-competitive-fishing/|title=Angry Birds Transformers Toys-To-Life Collaboration Announced|date=15 June 2014|access-date=15 June 2014|first=Chris|last=Stead}} |- | June 2015 || ''[[Angry Birds Fight!]]'' || [[Tile-matching video game|Tile-matching]], [[Role-playing video game|Role-playing]] || The 11th game of the series, which is a [[Tile-matching video game|match-3]] game to match birds to have enough power to defeat the enemy and features a gear system that can be upgraded.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/andyrobertson/2015/01/30/angry-birds-fight-review/|title="Angry Birds Fight!" is a Mix and Match RPG|publisher=Forbes}} |- | July 2015 || ''[[Angry Birds 2]]'' || [[Puzzle video game|Puzzle]] || This is the sequel to ''Angry Birds'' and the 12th game of the series that features the player picking the birds to launch into the pigs' fortresses in multistage levels.{{cite web|title=New Angry Birds Game Soft Launches in Canada |url=http://www.rovio.com/en/news/blog/625/new-angry-birds-game-soft-launches-in-canada |access-date=6 March 2015 |date=5 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150307042824/http://www.rovio.com/en/news/blog/625/new-angry-birds-game-soft-launches-in-canada/ |archivedate= 7 March 2015 |df= }}{{cite web|last1=Ashcraft|first1=Brian|title=Angry Birds 2 Will Be Released This Month|url=http://kotaku.com/angry-birds-2-will-be-released-this-month-1718181010|publisher=Kotaku|access-date=16 July 2015|date=16 July 2015}} |- |April 2016 ||''[[Angry Birds Action!]]'' || [[Puzzle video game|Puzzle]], [[Pinball]] || This is the 13th game of the series that features a top-down perspective in pinball-type levels, and the first game to feature the birds in their ''[[The Angry Birds Movie]]'' appearances.{{cite web|last1=|title=Angry Birds 2 Will Be Released This Month|url=http://www.pocketgamer.co.uk/r/iPad/Angry+Birds+ACTION%21/news.asp?b=related&c=69863|publisher=Pocket Gamer|access-date=26 April 2016|date=26 April 2016}} |- |December 2016 ||''[[Angry Birds Blast!]]'' || [[Tile-matching video game|Tile-matching]] || This is the 14th game of the series that features match-3 gameplay that has the player popping balloons to free the Angry Birds.{{cite web|last1=|title='Angry Birds Blast' Launching Globally Dec. 22nd|url=http://toucharcade.com/2016/12/20/angry-birds-blast-launching-globally-dec-22nd/|publisher=Touch Arcade|access-date=26 December 2016|date=26 December 2016}} |- |June 2017||''[[Angry Birds Evolution]]'' || [[Role-playing video game|Role-playing]], [[Pinball]] || The 15th game of the series, which is a turn-based RPG battle game that is played similar to ''Angry Birds Action!'', with a large all-new cast of fully limbed characters that are similar in appearance to the characters of ''The Angry Birds Movie''.{{cite web|last1=Gordon|first1=Scott Adam|title=Angry Birds Evolution coming to the US this June|url=http://www.androidauthority.com/angry-birds-evolution-android-773854/|website=Android Authority|access-date=15 June 2017}} |- |August 2017||''Angry Birds Match'' || rowspan="2" | [[Tile-matching video game|Tile-matching]] || The 16th game of the series, which is a match-3 game involving the Hatchlings and characters from ''[[Angry Birds Blues]]'', where players match items to accomplish missions on behalf of the Hatchlings, which include gathering food, retrieving stolen toys and defeating pigsgame |- |February 2018||''Angry Birds Blast Island'' || The 17th game of the series which features match-3 gameplay where players can earn stars to clean up or fix various things on the island.{{cite web|last1=Ric Cowley|first1=Ric Cowley|title= Rovio soft-launches casual puzzle sequel Angry Birds Blast Island|url=http://www.pocketgamer.biz/news/67480/rovio-soft-launches-angry-birds-blast-island/|website=Pocket Gamer.biz|access-date=8 February 2018}} |- |September 2018 |Angry Birds Dream Blast | |The 18th game of the series, itself a spin-off of ''Blast''. Utilizes ball physics as players clear groups of balls of the same color to complete objectives.{{cite web |last1=Harris |first1=Iain |title=Rovio soft-launches Angry Birds Dream Blast in Finland and the UK |url=https://www.pocketgamer.biz/news/69218/rovio-soft-launches-angry-birds-dream-blast-in-finland-and-the-uk/ |website=pokcetgamer.biz |accessdate=22 November 2018 |date=8 October 2018}}{{cite web |title=App Store listing for Angry Birds Dream Blast |url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/app/angry-birds-dream-blast/id1432579280?mt=8 |website=iTunes App Store |accessdate=22 November 2018}}{{cite web |title=Google Play Store listing for Angry Birds Dream Blast |url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.rovio.dream |website=Google Play Store |accessdate=22 November 2018 |date=12 November 2018}} |} ===Spin-offs=== {|class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Game !! Genre !! Description |- | September 2012 || ''[[Bad Piggies]]'' || rowspan="2" | [[Puzzle video game|Puzzle]] || Players must build vehicles to bring the pigs to their destinations.{{cite web|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/business/latest/after-angry-birds-success-rovio-to-launch-bad-piggies/story-e6frg90f-1226465189626|title=After Angry Bird's success, Rovio to launch Bad Piggies|publisher=Business}} |- | September 2014 || ''[[Angry Birds Stella]]'' || Reuses the original physics-puzzle game play of Angry Birds, but with a cast of new birds.{{cite web|url=http://news.softpedia.com/news/Angry-Birds-Stella-Launches-in-the-Fall-Introduces-Five-New-Bird-Types-426600.shtml|title=Angry Birds Stella Launches in the Fall, Introduces five new bird types|publisher=Softpedia|date=|access-date=25 April 2014}} |- | March 2015 || ''[[Angry Birds POP!]]'' || [[Tile-matching video game|Tile-matching]] ||It was the second game in the ''Stella'' series originally titled ''Angry Birds Stella POP!'', where players must match bubbles to pop them and eventually must complete given objectives.[http://www.rovio.com/en/news/press-releases/626/stella-bursts-bubbles-with-global-launch-of-angry-birds-stella-pop Stella bursts bubbles with global launch of Angry Birds Stella POP!] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402163807/http://www.rovio.com/en/news/press-releases/626/stella-bursts-bubbles-with-global-launch-of-angry-birds-stella-pop |date=2 April 2015 }}. Retrieved 18 March 2015. In July 2015, the "Stella" name was removed from the title so it was renamed ''Angry Birds POP!''. |- |February 2018 |''Angry Birds Champions'' |Puzzle |A competitive [[player-versus-player]] game where players take turns beating a traditional ''Angry Birds'' level, aiming to outscore opponents, with monetary prizes at stake.{{cite web |last1=Conditt |first1=Jessica |title='Angry Birds Champions' lets players fling pheasants for real money |url=https://www.engadget.com/2018/02/21/angry-birds-champions-real-money-tournaments-ios-esports/ |website=engadget |accessdate=22 November 2018 |date=21 February 2018}} |} ===Compilations=== {|class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Game !! Genre !! Description |- | 2012 || ''[[Angry Birds Trilogy]]'' || [[Puzzle video game|Puzzle]] || A compilation of the first three ''Angry Birds'' games (the original, Seasons and Rio) for video game consoles.{{cite web|url=http://www.housemarque.com/2012/07/12/housemarque-and-rovio-team-up-for-angry-birds-trilogy/ |title=Housemarque and Rovio team up for Angry Birds Trilogy |publisher=Housemarque.com |date= |access-date=25 April 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140525232520/http://www.housemarque.com/2012/07/12/housemarque-and-rovio-team-up-for-angry-birds-trilogy/ |archivedate=25 May 2014 |df= }} |} ===Cancelled=== The following games were [[Soft launch|soft-launched]] in select countries in 2016 or 2017, but were never given a final, worldwide release. *''Angry Birds Goal!'', an association football game involving birds as they appear in ''The Angry Birds Movie, later renamed in Angry Birds Football.''{{cite web|title=Rovio cancels Angry Birds Football after seven months in soft launch|url=http://www.pocketgamer.biz/news/64419/rovio-cancels-angry-birds-football/|website=PocketGamer}} *''Angry Birds Ace Fighter'', a top-down scrolling [[shoot 'em up]] game, before called AB Sky Fighters.{{cite web|title=Facebook page showing Angry Birds Ace Fighter shutdown date|url=https://www.facebook.com/Angry-Birds-Ace-Fighter-590214987816500/}} *''Angry Birds Holiday'', an endless [[Construction and management simulation|business management simulator]] involving most Angry Birds characters as they appear in ''The Angry Birds Movie'', who run vacation resort services for incoming pigs to distract them from the eggs, only launched on IOS systems. *''Angry Birds Islands'', a village building game where birds and pigs work together. The pigs will collect and create resources, while birds fight monsters to rescue piglets, or deliver resources in quests.{{cite web|title=Facebook page showing Angry Birds Islands shutdown date|url=https://www.facebook.com/AngryBirdsIslands/photos/a.1758925214329937.1073741828.1731232490432543/1791086837780441/?type=3}} *''Angry Birds Dice'', an online virtual board game, involving Angry Birds characters as they appear in ''The Angry Birds Movie'' and soft-launched by the Korean mobile game company Joycity, in which players attempt to collect property and bankrupt their opponents by having them land on it, similar to Monopoly.{{cite web|title=Facebook page showing Angry Birds Dice shutdown date|url=https://www.facebook.com/angrybirdsdice/}} == Media == [[File:Angry Birds logo.svg|thumb|The original ''Angry Birds'' wordmark, used on the [[Angry Birds (video game)|original video game]] from December 2009 to April 2010]] [[File:Angry Birds logos.svg|thumb|The ''Angry Birds'' wordmark, used on video games, merchandise and television shows from April 2010 to present]] Rovio is investigating ways to expand the ''Angry Birds'' brand, including merchandise, television shows and movies. Mikael Hed, CEO of Rovio Mobile, has envisioned a feature film in the [[Stop motion|stop-motion animation]] style of [[Aardman Animations]].{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118023224?refCatId=13|title=''Angry Birds'' flies with Hollywood|author=Marc Graser|work=Variety|date=24 August 2010|access-date=29 November 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101028231138/http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118023224?refCatId=13| archivedate= 28 October 2010 | deadurl= no}} To that end, Rovio has purchased a [[Helsinki]]-based animation studio to prepare ''Angry Birds'' short cartoons on the [[Nicktoons (TV channel)|Nicktoons]] station's Nickelodeon Extra,{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/scitech/2011/10/19/angry-birds-aim-for-world-domination/|title=Angry Birds Aim For World Domination|work=FoxNews.com|date=19 October 2011|access-date=20 October 2011}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.econ.ucla.edu/sboard/teaching/tech/Rovio.pdf|title=Rovio and Angry Birds|last=Yanting Li|first=Christina Liu|date=|website=www.econ.ucla.edu|access-date=}} the first of which was a Christmas special named "Wreck the Halls" that debuted in December 2011.{{cite web|url=http://tv.ign.com/articles/121/1214992p1.html|title=Angry Birds Short Film Airing on Nicktoons|author=Eric Goldman|work=IGN.com|date=16 December 2011|access-date=19 December 2011}} Hed acknowledges that such a film would be years away, and that Rovio must keep the characters relevant until then, by producing sequels or new ports of the original game. ===Television adaptation=== ''[[Angry Birds Toons]]'', a TV series based on the game, made its debut on March 16, 2013. ''Angry Birds Toons'' is released through third-party video distribution platforms, including Comcast's Xfinity On-Demand in the US, Samsung Smart TVs, and Roku set-top boxes. It is also available in a number of countries on traditional television broadcasts. ''Angry Birds Toons'' is available on mobile devices by an additional ''Angry Birds Toons'' channel on all of the ''Angry Birds'' apps homescreens. DVD version for the TV series was released by [[Sony Pictures Home Entertainment]]. The series has a total of 3 seasons. On April 11, 2014, Rovio released "''[[Piggy Tales]]''", a stop motion animated series. It tells the stories of the Minion Pigs' life. On November 1, 2014, Rovio released "''[[Angry Birds Stella (TV series)|Angry Birds Stella]]''", a 2D/3D animated series, telling the stories of Stella's life and that of her friends on their own island. On July 12, 2015, ''Real Angry Birds'', inspired by the game ''Angry Birds'', premiered on ''[[Nat Geo Wild]]''. On March 10, 2017, Rovio released "''[[Angry Birds Blues]]''", a computer-animated series based on The Angry Birds Movie. It shows the lives of the Blues having fun, while the Hatchlings doing random stuff and ruining their plans. On July 3, 2017, [[Netflix]] and [[KidsClick]] picked up every Angry Birds Toons, Angry Birds Stella, and Piggy Tales episode in form of 23 compilations. On June 1, 2018, U.S. television production company Big Fish Entertainment announced that they would be partnering with Rovio to create a game show based on ''Angry Birds'' currently called ''Angry Birds Challenge''.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/tv/news/angry-birds-live-action-game-show-1202826011/|title=‘Angry Birds’ Live-Action Game Show in the Works From Big Fish, Rovio Entertainment (EXCLUSIVE)|first=Joe|last=Otterson|date=31 May 2018|publisher=}} On June 9, 2018, Angry Birds BirLd Cup series were released. ===Film adaptation=== A [[3D film|3D]] [[Computer animation|computer-animated]] film adaptation, ''[[The Angry Birds Movie]]'', was released on 20 May 2016, which fully [[Anthropomorphism|anthropomorphizes]] the characters for the first time in franchise history, giving them limbs and voices. Developed, produced and financed by [[Rovio Entertainment]], it is animated by [[Sony Pictures Imageworks]]{{cite news|last1=Vlessing|first1=Etan|title=Sony Pictures Imageworks, Rovio Pact for 'Angry Birds' Movie|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/sony-pictures-imageworks-rovio-pact-680750|access-date=2 October 2014|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=17 February 2014}} and distributed worldwide by [[Sony Pictures|Sony Pictures Entertainment]] under their [[Columbia Pictures]] banner.{{cite press release|title=Rovio's Angry Birds Feature Film Nests at Sony Pictures Entertainment |url=http://www.rovio.com/en/news/press-releases/299/rovios-angry-birds-feature-film-nests-at-sony-pictures-entertainment/ |publisher=Rovio |access-date=2 October 2014 |date=15 May 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006124511/http://www.rovio.com/en/news/press-releases/299/rovios-angry-birds-feature-film-nests-at-sony-pictures-entertainment/ |archivedate= 6 October 2014 |df= }} It is directed by animation veterans [[Clay Kaytis]] and [[Fergal Reilly]] in their directorial debut.{{cite news|last1=Roxborough|first1=Scott|title=Rovio Names Directors for 'Angry Birds' Movie|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/rovio-names-directors-angry-birds-646715|access-date=2 October 2014|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=10 October 2013}} [[Jon Vitti]] wrote the film's screenplay,{{cite news|last1=Kit|first1=Borys|title='Simpsons' Scribe Tapped to Pen 'Angry Birds' Animated Movie|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/simpsons-scribe-tapped-pen-angry-525662|access-date=2 October 2014|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=20 May 2013}} and John Cohen{{cite press release|title=John Cohen to Produce Angry Birds Movie for 2016|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=97954|publisher=ComingSoon.net|access-date=2 October 2014|date=11 December 2012}} and Catherine Winder served as the producers. Rovio also hired [[David Maisel]], former executive producer of [[Marvel Studios]] films such as ''[[Iron Man (2008 film)|Iron Man]]'', to be the executive producer of its feature-length films. A [[The Angry Birds Movie 2|sequel]] is scheduled to be released on August 16, 2019.{{cite news|last1=McNary|first1=Dave|title=‘Angry Birds Movie’ Sequel in the Works at Rovio|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/rovio-planning-angry-birds-movie-sequel-1201844515/|access-date=24 December 2016|work=Variety|date=25 August 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/sony-angry-birds-2-movie-september-2019-1202439770/|title=Sony Sets ‘Angry Birds 2’ Movie for Landing in September, 2019|first=Dave|last=McNary|date=22 May 2017|publisher=}}{{cite web |last1=Beck |first1=Jeff |title=Sony’s ANGRY BIRDS 2 nests in theaters 2 weeks earlier—now set for Sept. 6, 2019 instead of Sept. 20. |url=https://twitter.com/ERCboxoffice/status/1012089106434625537|website=Twitter |publisher=Exhibitor Relations |accessdate=June 27, 2018}}{{cite web|title='Angry Birds 2' To Fly In Late Summer 2019|url=https://deadline.com/2018/10/angry-birds-2-release-date-change-august-2019-1202484302/|publisher=Deadline|accessdate=October 17, 2018|date=October 16, 2018}} == Merchandise == === Toys adaptation === There have been several toys made from ''Angry Birds'' characters. The game's official website offers [[stuffed toy|plush]] versions of the birds and pigs for sale, along with T-shirts featuring the game's logo and characters.{{cite web|url=http://shop.angrybirds.com/|title=Angry Birds Shop|work=Rovio.com|access-date=30 November 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101209132200/http://shop.angrybirds.com/| archivedate= 9 December 2010 | deadurl= no}} In May 2011, [[Mattel]] released an ''Angry Birds'' [[board game]], titled "Angry Birds: Knock on Wood".{{cite news|url=http://gadgetwise.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/01/07/angry-birds-at-ces/?src=busln|title=Angry Birds at C.E.S.|author=Brian Stetler|work=New York Times|date=7 January 2011|access-date=8 January 2011}} Over 10 million ''Angry Birds'' toys have been sold thus far. Rovio opened the first official ''Angry Birds'' retail store in Helsinki on 11 November 2011 at 11:11 a.m. local time.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/angry-birds-opens-first-store-175717241.html|title=Angry Birds Opens First Store|work=Yahoo.com|date=11 November 2011|access-date=12 November 2011}} It expects to open its next retail store somewhere in China, considered the game's fastest-growing market. Merchandise has been successful, with 45% of Rovio's revenues in 2012 coming from branded merchandise.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/appsblog/2013/sep/18/angry-birds-star-wars-2-review-iphone-ipad-android|title=Angry Birds Star Wars II Review|year=2013|access-date=18 September 2013|publisher=The Guardian}} The most notable toys are the Telepods, created by [[Hasbro]]. These figures are created for ''[[Angry Birds Star Wars II]]'',{{cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2013/07/19/angry-birds-telepods-hands-on/|title=Hands-on with Angry Birds Star Wars 2 and Hasbro's Telepods (video)|author=Sarah Silbert|work=Engadget}} ''[[Angry Birds Go!]]'', [[Angry Birds Stella|Angry Birds ''Stella'']], and [[Angry Birds Transformers|Angry Birds ''Transformers'']].{{cite web|url=http://www.rovio.com/en/news/blog/467/rovio-and-hasbro-announce-angry-birds-stella-telepods/2014 |title=Rovio and Hasbro announce Angry Birds Stella Telepods! - Rovio Entertainment Ltd |publisher= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140512221612/http://www.rovio.com/en/news/blog/467/rovio-and-hasbro-announce-angry-birds-stella-telepods/2014 |archivedate=12 May 2014 |df= }} Telepods use a similar digital toy hybrid concept as Skylanders or Disney Infinity characters, but there is a different technology behind it.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/07/18/technology/personaltech/play-angry-birds-you-will.html|title=Play Angry Birds, You Will|date=18 July 2013|website=The New York Times}} These are figures used to "teleport" a character of the corresponding figure into the game by scanning a tiny QR code via the device's camera. The Telepod platform technology was invented by ReToy, a bMuse company, in partnership with Hasbro.{{cite web|url=https://www.rovio.com/news/angry-birds-star-wars-ii-30-million-telepods-scans-and-counting|title=Angry Birds Star Wars II: 30 million TELEPODS scans and counting!|date=28 May 2014|publisher=}} Telepods figures are not only for this use, but can also be used with the toy set that comes with the toy, like other Angry Birds board games. One of the 2012 New Models for [[Hot Wheels]] cars from [[Mattel]] is based on the Red, Blue, and Yellow Birds from ''Angry Birds''. The package card bears both the Hot Wheels and Angry Birds logo. In 2016, [[The Lego Group|Lego]] released six sets based on ''[[The Angry Birds Movie]]''.{{cite news|last1=Kamen|first1=Matt|title=Lego Angry Birds flock around upcoming movie|url=https://www.wired.co.uk/article/angry-birds-lego-revealed|access-date=29 May 2017|work=Wired UK|date=11 January 2016}} === Print publications adaptation === On 2011, Rovio published a cookbook titled "Bad Piggies: Egg Recipes", along with doodle books based on some characters of the game. After a few weeks of the release of Angry Birds Space, they also released Angry Birds Space books about numbers, alphabets, and stickers. On 20 March 2012, ''[[National Geographic]]'' published a paperback book titled ''Angry Birds Space: A Furious Flight Into The Final Frontier''{{cite web|title=National Geographic publishing Angry Birds book|url=http://www.edge-online.com/news/national-geographic-publishing-angry-birds-book|work=Edge|publisher=Future Publishing Limited|access-date=26 July 2012|author=Nathan Brown|date=19 March 2012}}{{cite web|title="Angry Birds Space" Q&A: Your Guide to the Angry Universe|url=http://newswatch.nationalgeographic.com/2012/03/08/angry-birds-space-qa-your-guide-to-the-angry-universe/|work=National Geographic News|publisher=National Geographic Society|access-date=26 July 2012|author=Victoria Jaggard|date=8 March 2012}} shortly before the release of ''Angry Birds Space'' which became available on 22 March 2012. National Geographic also has a book titled ''Angry Birds Feathered Fun'' for learning all about birds.{{cite web | title=Nat Geo Wild Animals in the Real World, the Real Angry Birds| publisher=HollywoodDailyStar.com| author=Gabrielle Pantera | url=http://www.hollywooddailystar.com/?p=4060| access-date=12 July 2015 }} In the same year, Rovio created a contest with the prize ''Angry Birds: Hatching a Universe'', a book about the franchise and all the characters. As of 10 March 2014, [[IDW Publishing]] announced{{cite web|url=http://www.idwpublishing.com/news/article/2734/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=14 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140513054827/http://www.idwpublishing.com/news/article/2734/ |archivedate=13 May 2014 |df= }} that they will be publishing Angry Birds Comics starting in June 2014, with Paul Tobin being the writer.{{cite web|url=http://www.angrybirdsnest.com/exclusive-interview-with-angry-birds-comic-book-writer-paul-tobin/|title=Exclusive interbiew with Angry Birds comic book writer, Paul Tobin|publisher=Angry Birds Nest|date=|access-date=25 May 2014}} === Food products adaptation === In early 2012, [[Olvi]] started to manufacture Angry Birds [[soft drink]]s, after licensing with Rovio{{cite web|title=Olvi pistää Angry Birdsit tölkkiin |url=http://www.mikropc.net/kaikki_uutiset/olvi+pistaa+angry+birdsit+tolkkiin/a772515?service=mobile&page=2|work=|publisher=|author=|date=9 September 2012|language=Finnish}} with two different tastes: ''Tropic'' (tropical fruits) and ''Paradise'' ([[pineapple]]-[[mandarin orange|mandarin]]). In September 2012 Olvi released two new tastes to the soft drink collection: ''Lagoon'' ([[pear]]-[[apple]]) and ''Space Comet'' ([[Orange (fruit)|orange]]-[[cola]]).{{cite web|title=Angry Birds Lagoon |url=http://www.olvi.fi/web/fi/angrybirdslagoon|work=|publisher=|author=|date=9 September 2012|language=Finnish}}{{cite web|title=Angry Birds Space Comet |url=http://www.olvi.fi/web/fi/angrybirdsspacecomet|work=|publisher=|author=|date=9 September 2012|language=Finnish}} == Parks and attractions == === Angry Birds Land adaptation === The game's characters have been used, officially or otherwise, in amusement park attractions. In September 2011, the [[Window of the World]] theme park in [[Changsha]], China opened an unlicensed ''Angry Birds'' attraction.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2011/09/16/scitech/main20107294.shtml|title=China steals "Angry Birds" for theme park|author=Charles Cooper|date=16 September 2011|access-date=12 November 2011|work=CBS News}} Visitors to the park uses a large slingshot to launch stuffed versions of the bird characters at green balloons that represent the pigs. [[File:Angry Birds Land Särkänniemi 11.jpg|thumb|Angry Birds Land in [[Särkänniemi]], Finland.|right]]Upon learning of the attraction, Rovio Entertainment reported to be considering working with the theme park to officially license it. In March 2012, Rovio announced plans for an official ''Angry Birds'' Land, that opened in 28 April 2012, at the [[Särkänniemi|Särkänniemi adventure park]] in Finland.{{cite web|author=2 March 2012 by Andrew Wooden |url=http://www.t3.com/news/angry-birds-land-to-hit-theme-park-in-finland |title=Angry Birds Land to hit theme park in Finland |publisher=T3 |date=2 March 2012 |access-date=24 April 2012}} Angry Birds Land opened in May 2014 at Johor Bahru City Centre in Malaysia.{{cite web|url=http://scandasia.com/angry-birds-malaysia-theme-park-to-open-in-2014/ |title=Angry Birds Malaysia Theme Park To Open In 2014 « Scandasia |publisher=Scandasia.com |date=5 June 2013 |access-date=28 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130613085557/http://scandasia.com/angry-birds-malaysia-theme-park-to-open-in-2014/ |archivedate=13 June 2013 |df= }} The first Angry Birds themed park in the UK, was created in Sundown Adventureland, an attraction in the Nottinghamshire countryside.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/travel/shortcuts/2012/aug/22/angry-birds-uk-theme-park|title=Angry Birds gets its own UK theme park|last=Saner|first=Emine|date=2012-08-22|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-08-30|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}} Most recently it was announced that UK theme park [[Thorpe Park]] would open their own Angry Birds Land themed area within the park in May 2014. The new area consists of the reinstatement of the 4D Cinema with a 10-minute-long Angry Birds film with 4D effects, a new addition of themed Angry Birds Dodgems and a slight re-theme of existing drop tower ride Detonator. === Angry Birds Activity Park adaptation === Rovio also opened "Activity Parks" of the game. The first one was opened in [[Lightwater Valley]]{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/article-2329541/Angry-Birds-Activity-Park-launches-Lightwater-Valley.html|title=Angry Birds Activity Park launches in Lightwater Valley|publisher=Dailymail|date=|access-date=25 May 2014}} that features dancefloors, and playgrounds that includes slides, and massive touchscreen devices for visitors to play Angry Birds. They also have Angry Birds Space attractions as part of the activity park, with a mini movie theater. They also include shops for Angry Birds merchandise and Birthday party rooms. The attraction also opened in Vuokatti. Vuokatti features obstacle courses and races,{{cite web|url=http://www.angrybirdsvuokatti.fi/en/Activity-Park/Angry-Birds-Arena|title=Angry Birds Arena|publisher=Vuokatti|date=|access-date=25 May 2014}} and a separate "Angry Birds Town" with cars for kids to ride. === Angry Birds Space Encounter adaptation === On June 2013, Rovio and NASA opened an Angry Birds Space-themed park at the [[Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex|Kennedy Space Center]] titled "Angry Birds Space Encounter".{{cite web|url=http://www.kennedyspacecenter.com/the-experience/angrybirds.aspx|title=The experience, Angry Birds|publisher=Kennedy Space Center|date=|access-date=25 May 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140514154231/https://www.kennedyspacecenter.com/the-experience/angrybirds.aspx|archivedate=14 May 2014|df=dmy-all}} It features various experiences to the Angry Birds Space video game, such as creating characters and shooting birds at pigs. The attraction was also opened in the [[Space Center Houston]]. === Angry Birds World adaptation === It was announced that the first Angry Birds World theme park will open at [[Doha Festival City]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.gulf-times.com/story/582338/In-a-global-first-Angry-Birds-World-theme-park-sla|title=In a global first, Angry Birds World theme park slated to open at DHFC|date=2018-02-20|work=Gulf-Times|access-date=2018-02-21|language=ar}} The first phase (which includes the indoor part) opened on June 3, 2018.{{cite web|url=https://thepeninsulaqatar.com/article/03/06/2018/Angry-Birds-World-park-opens-at-Doha-Festival-City|title=Angry Birds World park opens at Doha Festival City - The Peninsula Qatar|website=thepeninsulaqatar.com}} ==Reception and legacy== {{Video game series reviews | updated = September 5, 2017 | gr = no | game1 = [[Angry Birds (video game)|Angry Birds]] | mc1 = 80 | game2 = [[Angry Birds Seasons]] | mc2 = 78 | game3 = [[Angry Birds Rio]] | mc3 = 87 | game4 = [[Angry Birds Friends]] |mc4 = 65 | game5 = [[Angry Birds Space]] | mc5 = 83 | game6 = [[Angry Birds Star Wars]] | mc6 = 88 | game7 = [[Angry Birds Star Wars II]] | mc7 = 77 | game8 = [[Angry Birds Go!]] | mc8 = 60 | game9 = [[Angry Birds Epic]] | mc9 = 70 | game10 = [[Angry Birds Transformers]] | mc10 = 70 | game11 = [[Angry Birds Fight!]] | mc11 = 54 | game12 = [[Angry Birds 2]] | mc12 = 66 | game13 = [[Angry Birds Action!]] | mc13 = 75 | game14 = [[Angry Birds Blast!]] | mc14 = 66 | game15 = [[Angry Birds Evolution]] | mc15 = TBC | game16 = [[Angry Birds Match]] | mc16 = TBC | game17 = [[Angry Birds Blast Island]] | mc17 = TBC |game18=''[[Angry Birds Dream Blast]]''|mc18=N/A}} ==Global impact== === Television === The ''Angry Birds'' characters have been referenced in television programs throughout the world. The Israeli comedy show ''[[Eretz Nehederet]]'' (in English: ''a Wonderful Country''), one of the [[Television in Israel|nation's most popular TV programs]], satirized recent failed [[2010–11 Israeli–Palestinian peace talks|Israeli-Palestinian peace attempts]] by featuring the Angry Birds in peace negotiations with the pigs. Clips of the segment went [[Viral video|viral]], getting viewers from all around the world. The sketch received favorable coverage from a variety of independent blogs such as [[Digital Trends|digitaltrends.com]],{{cite news |url= http://www.digitaltrends.com/gaming/israeli-angry-birds-satire-goes-viral/?news=123|title=Israeli Angry Birds satire goes viral|date=23 November 2010|access-date=26 November 2010|first=Jeffrey|last=Van Camp|publisher=[[Digital Trends]]}} [[Hot Air|hotair.com]]{{cite news|url=http://hotair.com/archives/2010/11/25/breakthrough-peace-talks-begin-to-settle-bitter-longstanding-conflict/|publisher=[[Hot Air|]]|date=25 November 2010|access-date=26 November 2010|title=Breakthrough: Peace talks begin to settle bitter longstanding conflict| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101128062704/http://hotair.com/archives/2010/11/25/breakthrough-peace-talks-begin-to-settle-bitter-longstanding-conflict/| archivedate= 28 November 2010 | deadurl= no}} and intomobile.com,{{cite news|title=The Angry Birds Peace Treaty didn’t turn out so well|url=http://www.intomobile.com/2010/11/23/the-angry-birds-peace-treaty-didnt-turn-out-so-well/|date=23 November 2010|access-date=26 November 2010|publisher=intomobile}} as well as from online news media agencies such as ''[[Haaretz]]'',{{cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/israeli-satire-show-goes-viral-with-angry-bird-take-on-peace-talks-1.326157|date=22 November 2010|access-date=26 November 2010|title=Israeli satire show goes viral with Angry Bird take on peace talks|publisher=[[Haaretz]]| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101124022450/http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/israeli-satire-show-goes-viral-with-angry-bird-take-on-peace-talks-1.326157| archivedate= 24 November 2010 | deadurl= no}} ''[[The Christian Science Monitor]]'',{{cite news|first=Matthew|last=Shaer|date=29 November 2010|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/Innovation/Horizons/2010/1129/Angry-Birds-bound-for-Xbox-PlayStation|title=Angry Birds bound for Xbox, PlayStation|access-date=29 November 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101204195828/http://www.csmonitor.com/Innovation/Horizons/2010/1129/Angry-Birds-bound-for-Xbox-PlayStation| archivedate= 4 December 2010 | deadurl= no}} ''[[The Guardian]]'',{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/gamesblog/2010/nov/23/games-controversy|title=Angry Birds Treaty brings casual gaming into the world of satire|first=Keith|last=Stewart|work=The Guardian |location=UK |access-date=29 November 2010|date=23 November 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101125194328/http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/gamesblog/2010/nov/23/games-controversy| archivedate= 25 November 2010 | deadurl= no}} and [[MSNBC]].{{cite news|url=http://technolog.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2010/11/22/5509508-angry-birds-fail-to-negotiate-peace-treaty |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |access-date=29 November 2010 |title='Angry Birds' fail to negotiate peace treaty |first=Helen A.S. |last=Popkin |date=22 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101125132521/http://technolog.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2010/11/22/5509508-angry-birds-fail-to-negotiate-peace-treaty |archivedate=25 November 2010 |df= }} American television hosts [[Conan O'Brien]], [[Jon Stewart]] and [[Daniel Tosh]] have referenced the game in comedy sketches on their respective series, ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'', ''[[The Daily Show]]'', and ''[[Tosh.0]]''.{{Cite AV media |people=Conan O'Brien (host) |date=15 December 2010 |title=Conan's Message to Finland |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sU6ierlsI0I |medium=Television production |publisher=TBS |access-date=21 December 2010 |time=1:38| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101228092442/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sU6ierlsI0I| archivedate= 28 December 2010 | deadurl= no}}{{Cite AV media |people=Jon Stewart (host) |date=16 February 2011 |title=Intro – Watson Competes on Jeopardy |url=http://www.thedailyshow.com/watch/wed-february-16-2011/intro---watson-competes-on-jeopardy |medium=Television production}}{{Cite AV media |people=Daniel Tosh|date=11 January 2011 |title=Tosh.0: Angry Birds |url=http://tosh.comedycentral.com/video-clips/angry-birds |medium=Television production}} In the ''[[30 Rock]]'' episode [[Plan B (30 Rock)|"Plan B"]], guest star [[Aaron Sorkin]] laments to [[Liz Lemon]], "Our craft is dying while people are playing ''Angry Birds'' and poking each other on Facebook". He then provides a tip for Liz to improve her score in the game.{{citation needed|date=December 2015}} In February 2011, American journalist [[Jake Tapper]] mockingly introduced U.S. Senator [[Chris Coons]] as the "Angry Birds champion of the Senate" during the [[National Press Club (United States)|National Press Club's]] annual dinner.{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/02/10/chris-coons-mocks-jake-tapper_n_821246.html|title=Chris Coons Mocks Jake Tapper|work=[[HuffPost|Huffington Post]] |location=USA|date=10 February 2011|access-date=17 February 2011|first=Jack|last=Mirkinson}} Some of the game's more notable fans include ex-Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] of the United Kingdom, who plays the iPad version of the game, and author [[Salman Rushdie]], who claims he is "something of a master at ''Angry Birds''".{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748703945904575644940111605862|title=Why We Can't Stop Playing|author=Nick Wingfield|work=The Wall Street Journal|publisher=Dow Jones & Company, Inc.|date=30 November 2010|access-date=27 March 2011}} Basketball star [[Kevin Durant]] is an avid fan of ''Angry Birds'', and regularly plays other NBA stars in matches, although he is weary of cheating.{{cite web |url= http://www.celebritytweet.com/KDthunderup/link/69991866069827584/ |title=Man they be cheatin terrible on angry birds...make me wanna throw my phone out the window. |author=Kevin Durant @KDThunderup |work=celebritytweet.com |access-date=6 May 2012}} In August 2011, the [[Milwaukee Brewers]] played the ''Angry Birds'' theme song during the pre-game introductions of the arch-rival [[St. Louis Cardinals]] players, in reference to former Cardinals' manager [[Tony La Russa|Tony LaRussa's]] propensity to [[Beanball|bean]] opposing players.{{citation needed|date=December 2015}} ''Angry Birds'' also appears briefly, for comic relief, during a scene in the 2013 film ''[[G.I. Joe: Retaliation]]'', in which Zartan plays the game while waiting for the world leaders' response to his threats of annihilation.{{citation needed|date=December 2015}} Angry Birds were featured in the 2013 Helsinki episode of [[List of Veep episodes|Veep]].{{citation needed|date=December 2015}} Angry Birds was referenced in the film ''[[The Starving Games]]'', a parody of ''[[The Hunger Games (film series)|The Hunger Games]]''.{{citation needed|date=December 2015}} A group in the Indian show [[Dance Plus|Dance+]] have done a dance based on Angry Birds.{{citation needed|date=December 2015}}. Angry Birds was referenced in the [[Family Guy]] episode [[Turban Cowboy]] when after failed sky diving attempt by Peter results in him landing in a level. [[File:T-Mobile Angry Birds Advert.png|thumb|right|A screenshot from the T-Mobile advertisement. The advertisement was shown in [[Spain]] by [[Cosmote]]. ]] === Advertisements === ''Angry Birds'' and its characters have been featured in advertisements for other products. In March 2011, the characters began appearing in a series of advertisements for Microsoft's [[Bing (search engine)|Bing]] search engine.{{Cite AV media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WQiH4Hl4wE4|title=Angry Birds Bing Video – Episode 1|publisher=Rovio Mobile|access-date=7 March 2011}} At the 2011 [[South by Southwest]] festival in [[Austin, Texas]], Nokia used [[scrim (lighting)|scrim]]s on a downtown building to project an advertisement for its new [[Nokia N8|N8 handset]] that included the game's characters.{{Cite AV media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BlWQjEZgO7M|title=Angry Birds On A 15 Storey Building At SXSW|date=12 March 2011|access-date=9 June 2011}} A June 2011 [[T-Mobile]] advertisement filmed in Barcelona, Spain included a real-life mock-up of the game in a city plaza,{{Cite AV media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jzIBZQkj6SY&feature=player_embedded|title=T-Mobile Angry Birds Live|access-date=9 June 2011}} while Nokia used the game in [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]] to promote an attempt to set a world record for the largest number of people playing a single mobile game.{{cite web|url=http://www.greyreview.com/2011/06/11/photos-world-record-attempt-at-worlds-biggest-angry-birds-playground-in-kuala-lumpur|title=Guinness World Record at Nokia World’s Biggest Angry Birds Playground in Kuala Lumpur|author=Lim Yung Hui|work=greyreview.com|date=11 June 2011|access-date=14 December 2011}} [[Finnair]] has also used Angry Birds in their advertising, including taping an [[Airbus A340]] airliner with the Angry Birds figures and holding an Angry Birds tournament on board a flight to Singapore.{{cite web|url=http://nycaviation.com/2011/09/angry-birds-take-over-finnair-flight/|title=Angry Birds Take Over Finnair Flight to Singapore - NYCAviation|author=Matt Molnar|date=21 September 2011|access-date=22 January 2012}} Rovio has also prepared a number of web-based promotional variants of ''Angry Birds'' themed around creations of other companies, such as Finnish snack company [[Fazer]],{{cite web|url=http://fazer.angrybirds.com|title=Angry Birds Volcano|publisher=}} Spanish pizza delivery chain [[Telepizza]],{{cite web|url=http://telepizza.angrybirds.com|title=Angry Birds Тelepizza|publisher=}} and Japanese television network [[Fuji Television|Fuji TV]],{{cite web|url=http://angrybirds.fujitv.co.jp |title=Angry Birds Fujitv |publisher= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121016192250/http://angrybirds.fujitv.co.jp/ |archivedate=16 October 2012 |df= }} as well as promotions of American brands including [[Cheetos]],{{cite web|url=https://www.cheetos-angrybirds.com |title=Cheetos Angry Birds |work=Rovio |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130308025937/http://www.cheetos-angrybirds.com/ |archivedate= 8 March 2013 |df= }} [[The Wonderful Company|Wonderful Pistachios]]{{cite web|url=http://getcrackin.angrybirds.com|title=Angry Birds Pistachios|publisher=}} and [[Coca-Cola]].{{cite web|url=http://coca-cola.angrybirds.com/ |title=Angry Birds Coca-Cola |work=Angry Birds |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120828104146/http://coca-cola.angrybirds.com/ |archivedate=28 August 2012 |df= }} On November 2013, Indian brand [[Parle Products|Parle]] started a marketing campaign in which a trading card is included in each packet of Parle's Wafers and it included a related contest to win Angry Birds merchandise.[http://article.wn.com/view/2013/12/17/After_cookies_Parle_gets_Big_B_for_confectionery/ After cookies, Parle gets Big B for confectionery ] Retrieved 3 February 2015. In February 2016, [[Cadbury#India|Cadbury India]] had Angry Birds small figurines or tattoos in Cadbury Gems packs or Surprise balls.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dK3FGBMFD0k Angry Birds Gems Surprise Ball Limited Edition Mega Unboxing] Retrieved 11 March 2016. In June 2016, [[Kurkure|Kurkure India]] started an offer to win daily themed prizes and a trip to Angry Birds Activity Park in Malaysia.{{Citation|last=|title=Kurkure Cheese Balls - Angry Birds Promotion|date=|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vfIdU2hrlcw|access-date=16 July 2016}} [[File:Hockey VM maskot.jpg|thumb|Hockey VM mascot]] === Sports === [[File:Heikki Kovalainen 2012 Malaysia FP2.jpg|thumb|right|Kovalainen wearing an Angry Birds-themed helmet at the [[2012 Malaysian Grand Prix]]]] Finnish [[Formula One]] driver [[Heikki Kovalainen]] used an Angry Birds-themed helmet in the [[2012 FIA Formula One World Championship|2012 season]], following a sponsorship deal with Rovio. Angry Birds also sponsored the [[Lotus F1|Lotus F1 Team]] that year, with its logo on the top of each Lotus Renault F1 car's nosecone. As part of the deal, fellow Finn [[Kimi Räikkönen]] ran an Angry Birds 'Space' logo on his branded caps.[http://www.lotusf1team.com/Watch-Out-The-Birds-Have-Landed.html Watch Out ! The Birds Have Landed ! 'Lotus F1 Team Angry Birds' Game Goes Live !] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121001035222/http://www.lotusf1team.com/Watch-Out-The-Birds-Have-Landed.html |date=1 October 2012 }}. Lotus F1 Team (23 May 2012). Retrieved on 2012-09-05. Hockey Bird, an angry hockey playing bird, was the official mascot of the [[2012 IIHF World Championship|2012 IIHF Ice Hockey World Championships]]. It was designed by Toni Kysenius and Rovio Entertainment.{{cite web|url=http://www.iihf.com/nc/home-of-hockey/news/news-singleview/article/born-hockey-bird.html |title=Born: Hockey Bird! |publisher=Iihf.com |date= |access-date=22 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120117144053/http://www.iihf.com/nc/home-of-hockey/news/news-singleview/article/born-hockey-bird.html |archivedate=17 January 2012 |df= }} [[Premier League]] association football club [[Everton F.C.]] inked a deal with Rovio in 2017, whereby the Angry Birds logo appears on the club shirt's left sleeve beginning from the [[2017–18 Premier League]] campaign.{{cite web|title=Everton Sign Sleeve Deal With Games Giant Rovio Entertainment |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/16/everton-sign-sleeve-deal-with-games-giant-rovio-entertainment |work=Everton FC |access-date=17 September 2017}} === Video games === The game's popularity has spawned knock-off and parody games that utilize the same basic mechanics as ''Angry Birds''. For example, ''Angry Turds'' features monkeys hurling feces and other objects at hunters who have stolen their babies.{{cite web|url=http://www.intomobile.com/2011/01/31/bored-with-angry-birds-try-angry-turds/|title=Bored with Angry Birds? Try Angry Turds|author=Marc Flores|work=IntoMobile.com|date=31 January 2011|access-date=5 February 2011}} Another game, titled ''Chicks'n'Vixens'' and released in beta form on Windows Phone devices, replaces the birds and pigs with chickens and foxes, respectively.{{cite web|url=http://www.slashgear.com/chicksnvixens-brings-angry-birds-clone-to-wp7-as-rovio-protest-video-02129963/|title=Chicks’n'Vixens brings Angry Birds clone to WP7 as Rovio protest|author=Chris Davies|work=Slashgear.com|date=2 February 2011|access-date=5 February 2011}} The developer of ''Chicks'n'Vixens'' intended the game as a challenge to Rovio Mobile, which stated at the time that a Windows Phone port of ''Angry Birds'' would not be ready until later in 2011. The ''Angry Birds'' theme song (''Balkan Blast Remix'') and its characters appear in ''[[Just Dance 2016]]''.{{cite web|last1=Cardoso|first1=Jose|title=Angry Birds infiltrates Just Dance 2016's tracklist|url=http://www.gamezone.com/news/angry-birds-infiltrates-just-dance-2016-s-tracklist-3422776|publisher=Gamezone|access-date=20 August 2015|date=5 August 2015}} === Religion === ''Angry Birds'' has inspired works of religious analogy. A five-part essay titled "Angry Birds Yoga — How to Eliminate the Green Pigs in Your Life" was written by Giridhari Dasa of the [[International Society for Krishna Consciousness]] of Brazil, utilizing the characters and gameplay mechanics to explain various concepts of [[yoga]] in [[Gaudiya Vaishnavism]] as understood and interpreted by the Hare Krishna.{{cite web|url=http://pandavas.wordpress.com/2011/05/02/angry-birds%E2%84%A2-yoga-%E2%80%93-how-to-eliminate-the-green-pigs-in-your-life-part-i/ |title=Angry Birds™ Yoga – How to Eliminate the Green Pigs in Your Life, Part I |publisher=Giridhari Dasa |access-date=26 June 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://pandavas.wordpress.com/2011/05/02/angry-birds%E2%84%A2-yoga-%E2%80%93-how-to-eliminate-the-green-pigs-in-your-life-part-ii/ |title=Angry Birds™ Yoga – How to Eliminate the Green Pigs in Your Life, Part II |publisher=Giridhari Dasa |access-date=26 June 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://pandavas.wordpress.com/2011/05/06/angry-birds%E2%84%A2-yoga-%E2%80%93-how-to-eliminate-the-green-pigs-in-your-life-part-iii/ |title=Angry Birds™ Yoga – How to Eliminate the Green Pigs in Your Life, Part III |publisher=Giridhari Dasa |access-date=26 June 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://pandavas.wordpress.com/2011/05/10/angry-birds%E2%84%A2-yoga-%E2%80%93-how-to-eliminate-the-green-pigs-in-your-life-part-iv/ |title=Angry Birds™ Yoga – How to Eliminate the Green Pigs in Your Life, Part IV |publisher=Giridhari Dasa |access-date=26 June 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://pandavas.wordpress.com/2011/05/12/angry-birds%E2%84%A2-yoga-%E2%80%93-how-to-eliminate-the-green-pigs-in-your-life-final-part/ |title=Angry Birds™ Yoga – How to Eliminate the Green Pigs in Your Life, Final Part |publisher=Giridhari Dasa |access-date=26 June 2011}} The piece attracted much media attention, in Brazil and abroad, for its unique method of philosophico-religious presentation.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/video-games/8303173/Angry-Birds-the-story-behind-iPhones-gaming-phenomenon.html|title=Angry Birds: the story behind iPhone's gaming phenomenon|date=7 February 2011|access-date=26 June 2011|first=Paul|last=Kendall|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph|telegraph.co.uk]]|location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20110726150815/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/video-games/8303173/Angry-Birds-the-story-behind-iPhones-gaming-phenomenon.html| archivedate= 26 July 2011 | deadurl= no}}{{cite web|url=http://pandavas.wordpress.com/2011/06/15/angry-birds-yoga-making-a-splash-in-brazil/ |title=Angry Birds Yoga Making a Splash in Brazil | Giridhari’s Blog |publisher=Pandavas.wordpress.com |date=15 June 2011 |access-date=1 February 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dzai.com.br/fredbottrel/blog/topics?tv_pos_id=84461 |title=topics |publisher=Dzai.com.br |date= |access-date=1 February 2012}}{{cite news|url=http://news.iskcon.com/node/3726/2011-06-25/is_iskcon_devotee_s_angry_birds_yoga_set_to_go_viral|title=Is ISKCON Devotee's "Angry Birds Yoga" Set To Go Viral?|date=25 June 2011|access-date=26 June 2011|first=Madhava|last=Smullen|publisher=[[International Society for Krishna Consciousness]]}} The piece was also recognized and appreciated by Rovio Mobile's Peter Vesterbacka, who was prompted to comment on Twitter, "Very cool! I can see Angry Birds Yoga becoming a worldwide craze;-)". === Education === Rovio also launched the Angry Birds Playground in partnership with [[University of Helsinki]]. Based on the Finnish national curriculum the program covers maths, science, music, language, arts & crafts, physical education and social interaction. Focused on preschoolers of kindergarten age, the program introduced interactive learning material including books, posters, games and digital content.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/appsblog/2013/sep/16/angry-birds-playground-education-rovio|title=Angry Birds Playground: Rovio catapults gaming into the classroom|last=Dredge|first=Stuart|date=16 September 2013|work=The Guardian|accessdate=30 July 2018}} In 2015, a spin-off from the Rovio Angry Birds Playground was established as [https://funacademy.fi/ Fun Academy] by co-founder and CEO Sanna Lukander, former Rovio's vice president of learning and book publishing, and co-founder [[:fi:Peter_Vesterbacka|Peter Vesterbacka]], former Rovio's ‘Mighty Eagle’. {{Cite web|url=https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20160128005521/en/Rovio-Entertainment-Rovio-Spins-Education-Business-Create|title=Rovio Entertainment: Rovio Spins off Education Business to Create Fun Academy|last=|first=|date=28 January 2016|website=Business Wire|archive-url=|archivedate=|dead-url=|accessdate=30 July 2018}} Fun Academy is currently present in 9 countries across the world. == Controversy == === Leaking user data === In January 2014, it was revealed that ''Angry Birds'' was considered a "leaky app" and was used to collect data about its users including their sexual orientation and location by the [[National Security Agency]] (NSA) and [[Government Communications Headquarters|GCHQ]]. In retaliation, anti-NSA hackers defaced Rovio's Web site. Claims were made by [[Edward Snowden]] that the app was ''leaky'' and that they were capable of [[siphon]]ing data.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-2548134/Angry-Birds-come-crashing-Maker-Rovios-site-hacked-NSA-spy-scandal-revealed-leaky-app-used-gather-data-users.html |title=Angry Birds come crashing down: Rovio's site hacked after NSA spy scandal revealed it was a 'leaky app' used to gather data on users |date=29 January 2014 |work= [[Daily Mail]]|access-date=30 January 2014}} According to ''[[The Register]]'', the information was leaked through the in-game advertisement code like that embedded by [[One by AOL|Millennial Media]]: "Millennial's tracking software generates a personal record for each user that can store information from their political affiliation and sexual orientation to whether their marital state was single, married, divorced, engaged or 'swinger'. This information is used to target in-app ads more effectively, and can be collected by UK and US intelligence agencies for analysis".{{cite web|url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2014/01/27/leaking_smartphone_apps_nsa_gchq/|title=Fancy a little kinky sex? GCHQ+NSA will know - thanks to ANGRY BIRDS|work=theregister.co.uk}} In a statement to the press, Rovio denied that they were providing any information to the intelligence agencies, but did not exclude the possibility that their advertisers might do so. Following this revelation, on 29 January, the Angry Birds site was defaced by hackers who replaced it with "Spying Birds" via a [[DNS hijacking]] attack. According to Rovio, "The defacement was caught in minutes and corrected immediately".{{cite web|url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/2092560/hackers-deface-angry-birds-website-following-nsa-spying-claims.html|title=Hackers transform Angry Birds website into 'Spying Birds' following NSA claims|author=Lucian Constantin|date=29 January 2014|work=PCWorld}} The [[Syrian Electronic Army]] tweeted after the incident that the attack had been carried out by "a friend" of theirs.{{cite web|url=https://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2430080,00.asp|title=Angry Birds Website Defaced After NSA Spying Allegations|work=PCMAG}} == See also == {{Portal|Finland|Video games|2010s}} * ''[[Boom Blox]]'' * ''[[Crush the Castle]]'' {{Clear}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commons|Angry Birds}} * {{Official website|1=https://www.angrybirds.com/}} {{Spoken Wikipedia-2|2016-01-27|En-Angry_Birds-article.ogg|En-Angry_Birds_2of2-article.ogg|}} {{Rovio Games}} [[Category:Angry Birds| ]] [[Category:Fictional birds]] [[Category:Indie video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Finland]] [[Category:Video game franchises introduced in 2009]] [[Category:Media franchises]] [[Category:Video games adapted into films]] [[Category:Video games adapted into television programs]]

{{italic title}} {{unreferenced|date=May 2008}}
[[Image:Antarleena1.jpg|right|150px]]
'''''Antarleena''''' is a [[Bengali language|Bengali]] novel by [[Narayan Sanyal]], published in 1962 with a cover design by [[Gautam Ray]]. This novel is placed in the background of psychiatry and psychoanalysis, hence the name{{Citation needed|date=May 2008}}. The psychoanalytic intrigue between Krishanu and Swaha, the main characters, makes this novel unique in Bengali literature.
The story deals with the protagonist's strange psychological condition and his attempts to deal with it. Meanwhile, his life becomes intertwined with three women, who are drawn by his mysterious behaviour and are dealing with their own past. Finally the story turns into a thriller when the protagonist has to retire from his job at the intelligence department due to a life-threatening accident resulting in a nervous breakdown and vertigo making his prevailing condition more complex, while one of the women from his past is facing split personality and murder attempts.
==External links== * [https://books.google.com/books/about/Antarlina.html?id=aZqhYgEACAAJ&redir_esc=y ''Antarlina'' at Google Books] * [https://books.google.com/books?id=_-MRAQAAIAAJ&q=inauthor:%22Narayan+Sanyal%22&dq=inauthor:%22Narayan+Sanyal%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=vDUNUPmdHc3RrQfErYXICA&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBjgK ''Antarlīnā'' at Google Books]
[[Category:1962 novels]] [[Category:Novels by Narayan Sanyal]] [[Category:20th-century Indian novels]] [[Category:1962 Indian novels]]
